# NODE 2: OPM ‚Äî "The Executioner"

**Analyst:** GitHub Copilot (Claude, Opus 4.6)
**Created:** February 10, 2026
**Scope:** January 20, 2025 ‚Äì February 10, 2026
**Sources:** OPM.gov, Federal Register, FedWeek, FedSmith, GovExec, Federal News Network, DailyFED, National Law Review, Holtzman Vogel, DCPAS (DoD)

---

## Executive Summary

OPM (Office of Personnel Management) functioned as the **execution node** of the administrative consolidation loop. Its role was to:

1. **Transmit** DOGE mandates as formal personnel directives to agencies
2. **Process** RIFs, deferred resignations, and terminations at scale
3. **Reclassify** ~50,000 positions under Schedule Policy/Career (removing MSPB protections)
4. **Absorb** DOGE's workforce functions after DOGE's November 2025 disbanding

OPM transformed from a neutral civil service management agency into the **implementation arm** of the executive's workforce reduction agenda.

---

## Granular Timeline

### Phase 1: Immediate Execution of DOGE Mandates (Jan ‚Äì Mar 2025)

| Date | Event | Source | Significance |
|------|-------|--------|-------------|
| **Jan 20, 2025** | Acting Director Charles Ezell begins implementing EO 14158 | [GovExec](https://www.govexec.com/workforce/2025/01/new-schedule-f-guidance-shows-trump-white-house-rearing-fight/402532/) | OPM issues immediate guidance for Schedule F position identification. 90-day deadline for agencies to submit initial lists. |
| **Jan 20, 2025** | OPM issues Schedule F (Schedule Policy/Career) guidance | [GovExec](https://www.govexec.com/workforce/2025/01/new-schedule-f-guidance-shows-trump-white-house-rearing-fight/402532/) | Agencies directed to begin drafting lists of policy-influencing positions. Guidance asserts EO supersedes Biden-era civil service protections. |
| **Jan 28, 2025** | OPM sends "Fork in the Road" deferred resignation email | [OPM.gov](https://www.opm.gov/about-us/fork/original-email-to-employees/) | Mass email to 2M+ employees. Reply "resign" to accept. Pay through Sept 30, 2025. OPM implements Musk's Twitter playbook at federal scale. |
| **Feb 6-10, 2025** | Deferred resignation deadline (extended by court) | [Politico](https://www.politico.com/news/2025/02/06/federal-worker-buyout-deadline-00203022) | 40,000‚Äì60,000 accept. OPM processes all acceptances. |
| **Feb 2025** | OPM issues Age Discrimination compliance guidance | [GovExec](https://www.govexec.com/workforce/2025/02/opm-continues-tweak-deferred-resignation-provisions-unions-press-court-challenge/402966/) | Tweaks program for workers 40+. Shows OPM is iterating on program while it faces legal challenges. |
| **Feb 14, 2025** | OPM processes mass probationary employee terminations | Multiple sources | Agencies execute terminations using OPM-provided boilerplate language. No individual performance justification. |
| **Feb 26, 2025** | OPM/OMB joint guidance: Agency RIF and Reorganization Plans | [OPM](https://www.opm.gov/chcoc/transmittals/2025/OPM_OMB%20-%20guidance%20on%20DOGE%20workforce%20EO%202.26.25%20FINAL.pdf) | Agencies must submit plans by March 13. Focus: eliminate non-statutory offices, reduce headcount, leverage automation. |
| **Mar 2025** | USAID issues RIF notices via OPM procedures ‚Äî 4,600 employees | [Multiple sources](https://www.kff.org/global-health-policy/u-s-foreign-aid-freeze-dissolution-of-usaid-timeline-of-events/) | First major agency-level RIF using OPM machinery. Separation dates: July 1 and Sept 2, 2025. |

### Phase 2: Schedule F Rulemaking and Agency RIFs (Apr ‚Äì Oct 2025)

| Date | Event | Source | Significance |
|------|-------|--------|-------------|
| **Apr 2025** | OPM publishes proposed Schedule Policy/Career regulations | Federal Register (proposed rule) | Formal rulemaking begins. Public comment period opens. |
| **Apr 2025** | Agencies begin submitting position lists to OPM | GovExec, FedSmith | Identification of "policy-influencing" roles across all agencies. |
| **Jul 1, 2025** | USAID formally ceases operations ‚Äî absorbed by State Department | [ABC News](https://abcnews.go.com/Health/usaid-programs-now-run-state-department-agency-ends/story?id=123373289) | Only 718 of ~10,500 positions survive (6.8%). OPM processed all RIF paperwork. |
| **Jul 2025** | MSPB overwhelmed by appeal volume | [DailyFED](https://dailyfed.com/2025/07/mspb-facing-processing-challenges/) | OPM-processed terminations generate unprecedented MSPB caseload. System cannot provide timely relief. |
| **Sept 2, 2025** | Final USAID operations wind down | [CGDev](https://www.cgdev.org/blog/usaid-fait-accompli) | Complete agency dissolution. OPM procedure fully executed. |
| **Sept 30, 2025** | "Fork in the Road" deferred resignations take effect | OPM | 40,000‚Äì60,000 employees formally separate from federal service. |

### Phase 3: DOGE Absorption and Permanent Lock-In (Nov 2025 ‚Äì Feb 2026)

| Date | Event | Source | Significance |
|------|-------|--------|-------------|
| **Jul 2025** | Scott Kupor sworn in as OPM Director | [FedSmith](https://www.fedsmith.com/2025/07/15/scott-kupor-sworn-in-as-opm-director/), [ExecutiveGov](https://executivegov.com/articles/scott-kupor-opm-director-federal-workforce-performance-management-standards) | Former founding employee and managing partner of Andreessen Horowitz (a16z). a16z is funded by Sanabil Investments (PIF/Saudi sovereign wealth). Brings private-sector VC approach to federal workforce management. |
| **Nov 2025** | OPM absorbs DOGE workforce functions | [HR Grapevine](https://www.hrgrapevine.com/us/content/article/2025-11-24-opm-takes-charge-as-the-elon-musk-led-department-quietly-vanishes) | **Critical transition**: DOGE's temporary mandate becomes OPM's permanent function. OPM now *is* the workforce reduction apparatus. |
| **Nov 2025** | Kupor confirms "DOGE doesn't exist"; states "no target around reductions" | [CNBC](https://www.cnbc.com/2025/11/24/doge-doesnt-exist-with-eight-months-left-on-its-charter.html), [WTOP](https://wtop.com/government/2025/08/new-opm-director-estimates-300000-federal-job-cuts-this-year-no-plans-to-relocate-jobs-from-dc/) | Normalization: reductions no longer need explicit targets; they proceed through operational momentum. |
| **Nov 2025** | 317,000 federal employees departed in 2025 (exceeded 300K target) | [Federal News Network](https://federalnewsnetwork.com/workforce/2025/11/317000-feds-have-left-the-government-this-year-surpassing-opms-goal/) | Scale: exceeded original target by 17,000. Primarily voluntary separations, not RIFs. |
| **Nov 2025** | Hiring freeze lifted; 1:4 replacement ratio continues | [Partnership for Public Service](https://ourpublicservice.org/press-release/partnership-for-public-service-statement-in-response-to-reports-that-doge-has-been-disbanded/) | The freeze ends but the ratio ensures continued attrition. OPM administers the ongoing reduction. |
| **Nov 2025** | NTEU files FOIA lawsuit against OPM for Schedule Policy/Career position lists | [FEDweek](https://www.fedweek.com/fedweek/nteu-sues-for-release-of-positions-recommended-for-schedule-policy-career/), [Fed News Network](https://federalnewsnetwork.com/workforce-rightsgovernance/2025/11/federal-union-sues-opm-seeking-release-of-schedule-policy-career-records/) | Transparency challenge: OPM refused to disclose which positions agencies recommended for reclassification. |
| **Jan 20, 2026** | NTEU files second lawsuit challenging legality of Schedule Policy/Career EO | [NTEU 282](https://www.282nteu.org/copy-of-wrongfully-fired-employees) | Direct constitutional challenge to the executive order. Currently paused pending OPM rulemaking completion. |
| **Feb 5, 2026** | Schedule Policy/Career final rule published | [Federal Register](https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2026/02/06/2026-02375/improving-performance-accountability-and-responsiveness-in-the-civil-service) | ~50,000 positions reclassified to at-will. MSPB appeal rights stripped. 94% of 40,500 public comments opposed. Published regardless. |
| **Feb 5, 2026** | OPM issues implementing guidance for final rule | [DCPAS/DoD](https://www.dcpas.osd.mil/sites/default/files/2026-02/OPM%20Memo%20Initial%20Implementing%20Guidance%20for%20Schedule%20Policy%20-%20Career%20Final%20Rule%202-5-2026.pdf) | Agencies given procedures for reclassifying positions. President has final authority over designations. |
| **Feb 27, 2026** | Court-ordered OPM disclosure deadline (NTEU FOIA lawsuit) | [FEDweek](https://www.fedweek.com/fedweek/nteu-sues-for-release-of-positions-recommended-for-schedule-policy-career/), [NTEU 282](https://www.282nteu.org/copy-of-wrongfully-fired-employees) | **UPCOMING**: Judge ordered OPM to release position lists by this date. First public view of which positions/agencies are targeted. |
| **Mar 8‚Äì9, 2026** | Schedule Policy/Career effective date (pending) | Federal Register | 30-day waiting period. Positions formally become at-will. |

---

## Structural Analysis: OPM's Transformation

### Before (Pre-Jan 2025)
- **Function**: Neutral civil service management
- **Role**: Administer merit-based hiring, manage personnel records, process routine RIFs
- **Orientation**: Protect civil service from political interference

### After (Post-Nov 2025)
- **Function**: Workforce reduction execution arm + permanent reclassification authority
- **Role**: Transmit executive workforce mandates, process mass terminations, strip civil service protections
- **Orientation**: Implement executive agenda through personnel machinery

### The Transformation Mechanism
1. DOGE designed workforce mandates (EOs, hiring freeze, "Fork in the Road")
2. OPM received those mandates and converted them to formal personnel actions
3. When DOGE was disbanded, OPM absorbed DOGE's functions
4. OPM then finalized the Schedule Policy/Career rule ‚Äî making the temporary permanent
5. **Result**: The agency designed to protect civil service now administers its restructuring

---

## RIF Architecture: How OPM Executed

### Standard RIF Process (Title 5, CFR Part 351)
RIFs must follow specific procedures:
- 60-day advance written notice to employees
- Retention based on tenure, veterans' preference, performance, length of service
- Employees can appeal to MSPB
- Agencies must demonstrate bona fide organizational reasons

### What Changed Under DOGE-Era OPM
1. **Probationary employee terminations** were used as a **parallel track** to avoid full RIF procedures. Probationary employees have limited (but not zero) appeal rights.
2. **Deferred resignation** was used as a **voluntary separation incentive** without requiring statutory buyout authority.
3. **Schedule Policy/Career reclassification** will convert ~50,000 competitive service positions to excepted service ‚Äî making future removals easier by eliminating MSPB appeal rights.
4. **The sequence**: Mass voluntary separations ‚Üí Mass probationary firings ‚Üí Full RIFs ‚Üí Schedule reclassification ‚Üí At-will removal authority

Each step reduces a different category of protection. Together, they constitute a **layered bypass** of civil service safeguards.

---

## Flags

### üö© Flag 1: OPM as the "Fork in the Road" Author
The "Fork in the Road" email came from OPM ‚Äî not DOGE. This matters because OPM has the statutory authority to communicate with federal employees about personnel matters. **DOGE designed the strategy (Musk's Twitter playbook); OPM gave it legal form.** The Architect designs; the Executioner gives it institutional legitimacy.

### üö© Flag 2: 94% Opposition, Published Regardless
94% of 40,500 public comments on the Schedule Policy/Career rule opposed it. OPM published it anyway. The public comment process ‚Äî designed as a democratic check on rulemaking ‚Äî was functionally bypassed. The rule proceeds on its own administrative momentum.

### üö© Flag 3: DOGE ‚Üí OPM Succession is Not Disbanding
When DOGE was "disbanded" in November 2025, its workforce functions were transferred to OPM. This is not the end of the consolidation program ‚Äî it is the **completion** of it. The temporary organization's mandate became a permanent agency's responsibility. The "disbanding" narrative obscures the fact that every structural change DOGE initiated is now institutionalized.

### üö© Flag 4: The MSPB Neutralization Sequence ‚Äî Now Quantified
1. Mass firings overwhelmed MSPB with thousands of appeals (Feb‚ÄìJul 2025) ‚Äî **2,145% increase in FY2025, ~12,000 new cases** (GovExec, DailyFED)
2. MSPB quorum temporarily lost again in 2025, further delaying relief (FedSmith)
3. Supreme Court blocked broad reinstatement orders
4. Schedule Policy/Career rule strips MSPB appeal rights for ~50,000 positions (Feb 2026)
5. **Net effect**: The appeals mechanism was first overwhelmed, then structurally eliminated for the highest-impact positions

### üö© Flag 5: The Kupor-a16z-Sanabil Structural Overlap (Added Feb 10)
OPM Director Scott Kupor was the founding employee and managing partner of Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), managing its growth from $300M to $90B+ AUM. a16z is directly funded by Sanabil Investments, the venture arm of Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund (PIF). The repo's Media Firewall section (`12_The_Media_Firewall/README.md`) already documents the PIF ‚Üí Sanabil ‚Üí a16z pipeline as a key intermediary layer between Gulf sovereign wealth and US infrastructure. The OPM Director who is eliminating MSPB protections for 50,000 positions came from the same firm that receives capital from the pipeline the repo has mapped. **This does not prove intent or impropriety** ‚Äî Kupor left a16z before joining OPM ‚Äî but it represents a structural overlap between the administrative consolidation and the Vendor-State capital architecture. The model should track *personnel flows* through intermediary layers, not just capital flows.
